item.title: Chicago's Money Launches in 2025
item.description: We're excited to announce the upcoming launch of Chicago's Money, your comprehensive source for Chicago public spending transparency.
item.content:encoded:
Chicago's Money is launching in 2025 with a mission to bring unprecedented transparency to Chicago's public spending.

What We'll Offer:

  • Employee Salary Database: Search over 35,000 city employee salaries
  • Budget vs Actual: Compare approved budgets with actual spending
  • Pension Crisis Tracker: Monitor the $2.8B annual pension payments
  • Department Deep Dives: Detailed analysis of each department's spending
  • Revenue Tracker: See where Chicago's $17.3B budget comes from
  • Lobbyist Watch: Track registered lobbyists and their expenditures

Sign up for early access at chicagosmoney.com

item.title: Why Chicago Needs Financial Transparency
item.description: Understanding where tax dollars go is fundamental to democracy and civic engagement.
item.content:encoded:
Chicago manages a budget of over $17 billion annually, yet many citizens don't know where their tax dollars go.

The Need for Transparency:

  • Chicago faces a $30+ billion pension crisis
  • Property taxes have increased 60% in the last decade
  • City debt continues to grow
  • Department spending lacks visibility

Chicago's Money aims to make this complex financial data accessible to everyone.

"Sunlight is the best disinfectant" - Justice Louis Brandeis

Join us in bringing transparency to Chicago's finances.
